member.name: T:BNSharp.Plugins.IPacketPriorityProvider
member.summary: When implemented, allows a class to provide custom packet parsing priorities for BN# via the RegisterCustomPacketPriorities method.

remarks.para: BN# uses a layered approach to custom packet priorities. By default, all packet priorities are Normal. Registering a new packet priority provider will allow the new provider to allow High or Low priorities to be defined without needing to define priorities for all packets.

Once a lookup is performed for a given packet ID, the result is cached and reused. Consequently, changing the priority value returned across multiple calls will only be reflected if the registered priority providers change across calls, at which point the cache is invalidated.
The priority providers are checked in the most-recently-registered order; so consequently, if three priority providers are registered in the order A, B, then C, then C will be checked first.

member.name: M:BNSharp.Plugins.IPacketPriorityProvider.Defines(BNSharp.BncsPacketId)
member.summary: Determines whether the packet provider specifies a priority for the given packet ID.
member.param: The ID of the packet to look up.
member.returns: if the packet ID is supported by this priority provider; otherwise .

member.name: M:BNSharp.Plugins.IPacketPriorityProvider.GetPriority(BNSharp.BncsPacketId)
member.summary: Gets a priority for the specified packet ID.
member.param: The packet ID to look up.
member.returns: A Priority for the specified packet ID that determines its parse order.

member.name: T:BNSharp.EventExceptionEventArgs
member.summary: Contains information about when a BN# connection event handler callback raises an exception.

remarks.para: Battle.net-related events driven by BattleNetClient are guaranteed to execute sequentially, in the order in which they were registered relative to other event handlers of their priority.

example.para: For example, consider a scenario in which there are three handlers registered for the UserJoined event; one is registered at High Priority and two are registered at Low priority:

Unlike normal .NET event handlers, every one of those handlers are guaranteed to be called back, regardless of whether a prior handler caused an exception to be thrown. However, if an exception is thrown, the EventExceptionThrown event will be raised on the client. So, the sequence of external method calls that would happen in such an event, if the Moderation handler threw an exception, would be something along these lines:

remarks.para: Typically, all listeners of the EventExceptionThrown event are not guaranteed to be called and follow normal .NET event semantics.

member.name: M:BNSharp.EventExceptionEventArgs.ToString
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this event data.

remarks.para: The results of this method vary based on the type of build passed. For builds with the DEBUG constant defined, the result will be a verbose response. For builds without it defined, it will limit itself to basic information. For more information, see ToString(string).

member.returns: A string representation of this event data.

member.name: M:BNSharp.EventExceptionEventArgs.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a string representation of this event data.
member.param: The type of representation to return. "v" results in verbose information; "b" results in basic information.
member.returns: A string representation of this event data.

remarks.para: Assumes all parameters are not null.

member.name: T:BNSharp.BattleNet.Stats.Diablo2Stats
member.summary: Represents statistics logged onto a Diablo II Realm character.

remarks.para: This class cannot be instantiated directly. To obtain an instance of this class, use UserStats.Parse, and cast the result to this class.
This class is only meaningful if the user is logged on as a realm character. To determine whether the user is logged on with a Realm character, check the IsRealmCharacter property.

member.name: T:BNSharp.BattleNet.Stats.UserStats
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, provides statistical information about a user.

remarks.para: More specific information is available from most users by casting an object of this class to one of the derived classes. Products and their relevant classes are provided in the following table:

item.term: Product
Starcraft Retail, Starcraft: Brood War, Starcraft Shareware, Japan Starcraft, Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition, Diablo Retail, Diablo Shareware
Diablo II Retail, Diablo II: Lord of Destruction
Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos, Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne
Others (unknown clients)

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.BncsPacket
member.summary: Completes a DataBuffer implementation with the additional data used by the BNCS protocol.

example.para: The following example illustrates creating a buffer that contains only the SID_NULL packet:
Note: this example assumes you have a Socket object called "sck" in the current context.
example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pckNull As New BncsPacket(0) sck.Send(pckNull.GetData(), 0, pckNull.Count, SocketFlags.None)

example.para: The following example illustrates calculating the revision check (SID_AUTH_ACCONTLOGON) of Warcraft III:
Note: this example assumes you have a Socket object called "sck" in the current context.
example.code: [Visual Basic] Dim pckLogin As New BncsPacket(&H51) Dim nls As New NLS(userName, password) nls.LoginAccount(pckLogin) sck.Send(pckLogin.GetData(), 0, pckLogin.Count, SocketFlags.None)

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer
member.summary: Operates as a data buffer for network and file output.

remarks.para: This class does not read data in any manner; for reading or receiving data, use the DataReader or derived classes.
This class always uses little-endian byte ordering.
This class no longer supports operator overloading in C# via the binary addition (+) operator.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer.InsertCString(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the specified value into the buffer as a C-style null-terminated ASCII string.
member.param: The string value to insert.

remarks.para: This method inserts a string terminated by a single null (0) byte.

member.exception: Either str or enc were null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer.InsertCString(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Inserts the specified value into the buffer as a C-style null-terminated string using the specified encoding.
member.param: The byte encoding to use.
The string value to insert.

remarks.para: This method inserts a string terminated by a null character. For 8-bit character encodings such as ASCII, this null character is also 8 bits. For 16-bit character encodings such as Unicode, this null character is also 16 bits.

member.exception: Either str or enc were null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer.InsertPascalString(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the specified value into the buffer as a pascal-style ASCII string.
member.param: The string value to insert.

remarks.para: This method inserts a string prefixed by the total number of characters in the string. At most a string may be 255 characters.

member.exception: Either str or enc were null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The length of str was too great; maximum string length is 255 characters.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer.InsertPascalString(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Inserts the specified value into the buffer as a pascal-style string using the specified encoding.
member.param: The encoding to use.
The string value to insert.

remarks.para: This method inserts a string prefixed by the total number of characters in the string. At most a string may be 255 characters.

member.exception: Either str or enc were null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The length of str was too great; maximum string length is 255 characters.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer.InsertWidePascalString(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the specified value into the buffer as a wide-pascal-style ASCII string.
member.param: The string value to insert.

remarks.para: This method inserts a string prefixed by the total number of characters in the string. At most a string may be 65,535 characters.

member.exception: Either str or enc were null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The length of str was too great; maximum string length is 65,535 characters.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer.InsertWidePascalString(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Inserts the specified value into the buffer as a wide-pascal-style string using the specified encoding.
member.param: The encoding to use.
The string value to insert.

remarks.para: This method inserts a string prefixed by the total number of characters in the string. At most a string may be 65,535 characters.

member.exception: Either str or enc were null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The length of str was too great; maximum string length is 65,535 characters.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer.InsertDwordString(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the specified value into the buffer as a 32-bit-style string using null bytes as the default padding.

remarks.para: This method inserts a string with the maximum length of 4 into the buffer, reversed. This mimics the C-style declarations of 4-character integer literals:
which results in RATS being in memory.

member.param: The string which may be at most 4 characters.
member.exception: The str parameter was null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The length of str was too great; maximum string length is 4 characters.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer.InsertDwordString(System.String,System.Byte)
member.summary: Inserts the specified value into the buffer as a 32-bit-style string using the specified byte as padding.

remarks.para: This method inserts a string with the maximum length of 4 into the buffer, reversed. This mimics the C-style declarations of 4-character integer literals:
which results in RATS being in memory.

member.param: The string which may be at most 4 characters.
The byte which shall be used to pad the string if it is less than 4 characters long.
member.exception: The str parameter was null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The length of str was too great; maximum string length is 4 characters.

member.name: T:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendUser
member.summary: Represents a Battle.net friend user.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendUser.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendStatus,BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendLocation,BNSharp.BattleNet.Product,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new FriendUser.
member.param: The 0-based index of the user's location.
The account name of the friend.
The friend's current status.
The friend's current location information.
The product with which the friend is currently logged on, otherwise .
The name of the friend's current location.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendUser.Index
member.summary: Gets, and in derived classes sets, the index (0-based) of the user on the client's friends list.

remarks.para: When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name Index.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendUser.AccountName
member.summary: Gets, and in derived classes sets, the account name of the friend.

remarks.para: When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name AccountName.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendUser.Product
member.summary: Gets, and in derived classes sets, a reference to the product information about the user's current logged on state.

remarks.para: This property will return if the user is currently offline.
When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name Product.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendUser.Status
member.summary: Gets, and in derived classes sets, contextual information about the user's status.

remarks.para: This property will return if the user is currently offline.
When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name Product.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendUser.LocationType
member.summary: Gets, and in derived classes sets, the type of location information provided by Battle.net.

remarks.para: When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name LocationType.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendUser.Location
member.summary: Gets, and in derived classes sets, the name of the location of the current user.

remarks.para: When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name Location.

member.name: T:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendMovedEventArgs
member.summary: Specifies that a friend has moved position in the client's list of friends (for example, by being promoted or demoted).

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendMovedEventArgs.#ctor(BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendUser,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new FriendMovedEventArgs.
member.param: The friend whose position changed.
The new 0-based index of the friend's position.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendMovedEventArgs.Friend
member.summary: Gets a reference to the friend whose position changed.

remarks.para: When this property's backing store is serialized as part of a WCF data contract, it is given the name Friend.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Friends.FriendMovedEventArgs.NewIndex
member.summary: Gets the new position of the friend (0-based).

remarks.para: When this property's backing store is serialized as part of a WCF data contract, it is given the name NewIndex.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey
member.summary: Provides utilities for decoding and otherwise validating CD keys of Blizzard products. This class cannot be inherited.
member.threadsafety: This type is safe for multithreaded operations.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a CD key decoder for the specified key.

remarks.para: This constructor only conducts initial validity checks to ensure that the CD key is valid; that is, it checks for a valid key length (13, 16, or 26 characters) and checks that the characters are valid for the key type. For example, Starcraft keys are numeric only, whereas Warcraft II, Diablo II, Lord of Destruction, Warcraft III, and The Frozen Throne keys are alphanumeric.
Additional validity checks are conducted internally; however, these do not raise Exceptions. To confirm the validity of a key after instantiation, call the CdKey.IsValid property.

member.param: The CD key to initialize processing for.
member.exception: Thrown if the value of cdKey is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Thrown if the CD key is an invalid length or does not pass initial validity checks.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.CreateDecoder(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a CD key decoder for the specified key.

remarks.para: This method only conducts initial validity checks to ensure that the CD key is valid; that is, it checks for a valid key length (13, 16, or 26 characters) and checks that the characters are valid for the key type. For example, Starcraft keys are numeric only, whereas Warcraft II, Diablo II, Lord of Destruction, Warcraft III, and The Frozen Throne keys are alphanumeric.
Additional validity checks are conducted internally; however, these do not raise Exceptions. To confirm the validity of a key after instantiation, call the CdKey.IsValid property.
This method is only a wrapper for the CdKey constructor and provides no additional functionality.

member.param: The CD key to initialize processing for.
member.exception: Thrown if the value of key is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Thrown if the CD key is an invalid length or does not pass initial validity checks.
member.returns: An instance of the CdKey class

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.GetValue2
member.summary: Gets the "Private" or "Value 2" value of the CD key.

remarks.para: This method returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the CD key is not valid. To check validity, use the IsValid property.
For Starcraft, Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition, Diablo II, or Lord of Destruction CD keys, this value is a 4-byte array. It can be converted to an integer value with the BitConverter class.
For Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos and The Frozen Throne CD keys, this value is a 10-byte array.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.GetHash(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the 20-byte hash value of the CD key.

remarks.para: The result of the hash calculation is used in the message 0x51 SID_AUTH_CHECK (from the client) as well as 0x36 SID_CDKEY2.

member.exception: Thrown if the object has not yet been initialized.
member.param: A randomly-generated token value that is determined by session at the client.
A randomly-generated token value that is determined by session at the server.
member.returns: A 20-byte array containing the hash value of the specified key.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.GetHash(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Computes the 20-byte hash value of the CD key. This method is not CLS-compliant.

remarks.para: The result of the hash calculation is used in the message 0x51 SID_AUTH_CHECK (from the client) as well as 0x36 SID_CDKEY2.

member.exception: Thrown if the object has not yet been initialized.
member.param: A randomly-generated token value that is determined by session at the client.
A randomly-generated token value that is determined by session at the server.
member.returns: A 20-byte array containing the hash value of the specified key.

member.name: P:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.Key
member.summary: Gets the CD key this object is processing.
member.exception: Thrown if the object has not yet been initialized.

member.name: P:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.Product
member.summary: Gets the product value encoded in the CD key.
member.remarks: This property returns 0 if the CD key is not valid. To check validity, use the IsValid property.
member.exception: Thrown if the object has not yet been initialized.

member.name: P:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.Value1
member.summary: Gets the "Public" or "Value 1" value of the CD key.
member.remarks: This property returns 0 if the CD key is not valid. To check validity, use the IsValid property.
member.exception: Thrown if the object has not yet been initialized.

member.name: P:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.Value2
member.summary: Gets the "Private" or "Value 2" value of the CD key.

remarks.para: This property returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the CD key is not valid. To check validity, use the IsValid property.
For Starcraft, Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition, Diablo II, or Lord of Destruction CD keys, this value is a 4-byte array. It can be converted to an integer value with the BitConverter class.
For Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos and The Frozen Throne CD keys, this value is a 10-byte array.

member.name: P:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CdKey.IsValid
member.summary: Gets whether or not the CD key is valid.
member.remarks: This property does not return whether or not this CD key is valid for Battle.net, but rather whether the product's installer would accept the key as valid.
member.exception: Thrown if the object has not yet been initialized.

member.name: T:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient
member.summary: Implements a client connection to Battle.net.

remarks.para: This is the primary class that should be used when implementing a Battle.net client. To implement one, you only need to implement the IBattleNetSettings interface, which provides information about a connection to Battle.net. Once this interface is implemented and this object is created, the client should register for events and that's it.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.RegisterUserJoinedNotification(BNSharp.Priority,BNSharp.UserEventHandler)
member.summary: Registers for notification of the UserJoined event at the specified priority.

remarks.para: The event system in the JinxBot API supports normal event registration and prioritized event registration. You can use normal syntax to register for events at Normal priority, so no special registration is needed; this is accessed through normal event handling syntax (the += syntax in C#, or the in Visual Basic.

Events in the JinxBot API are never guaranteed to be executed on the UI thread. Events that affect the user interface should be marshaled back to the UI thread by the event handling code. Generally, high-priority event handlers are raised on the thread that is parsing data from Battle.net, and lower-priority event handler are executed from the thread pool.

JinxBot guarantees that all event handlers will be fired regardless of exceptions raised in previous event handlers. However, if a plugin repeatedly raises an exception, it may be forcefully unregistered from events.

To be well-behaved within JinxBot, plugins should always unregister themselves when they are being unloaded or when they otherwise need to do so. Plugins may opt-in to a Reflection-based event handling registration system which uses attributes to mark methods that should be used as event handlers.

member.param: The priority at which to register.
The event handler that should be registered for this event.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.UnregisterUserJoinedNotification(BNSharp.Priority,BNSharp.UserEventHandler)
member.summary: Unregisters for notification of the UserJoined event at the specified priority.

remarks.para: The event system in the JinxBot API supports normal event registration and prioritized event registration. You can use normal syntax to register for events at Normal priority, so no special registration is needed; this is accessed through normal event handling syntax (the += syntax in C#, or the in Visual Basic.

Generally, high-priority event handlers are raised on the thread that is parsing data from Battle.net, and lower-priority event handler are executed from the thread pool.

JinxBot guarantees that all event handlers will be fired regardless of exceptions raised in previous event handlers. However, if a plugin repeatedly raises an exception, it may be forcefully unregistered from events.

To be well-behaved within JinxBot, plugins should always unregister themselves when they are being unloaded or when they otherwise need to do so. Plugins may opt-in to a Reflection-based event handling registration system which uses attributes to mark methods that should be used as event handlers.

member.param: The priority from which to unregister.
The event handler that should be unregistered for this event.

Generally, high-priority event handlers are raised on the thread that is parsing data from Battle.net, and lower-priority event handler are executed from the thread pool.

JinxBot guarantees that all event handlers will be fired regardless of exceptions raised in previous event handlers. However, if a plugin repeatedly raises an exception, it may be forcefully unregistered from events.

To be well-behaved within JinxBot, plugins should always unregister themselves when they are being unloaded or when they otherwise need to do so. Plugins may opt-in to a Reflection-based event handling registration system which uses attributes to mark methods that should be used as event handlers.

member.param: The priority from which to unregister.
The event handler that should be unregistered for this event.

Generally, high-priority event handlers are raised on the thread that is parsing data from Battle.net, and lower-priority event handler are executed from the thread pool.

JinxBot guarantees that all event handlers will be fired regardless of exceptions raised in previous event handlers. However, if a plugin repeatedly raises an exception, it may be forcefully unregistered from events.

To be well-behaved within JinxBot, plugins should always unregister themselves when they are being unloaded or when they otherwise need to do so. Plugins may opt-in to a Reflection-based event handling registration system which uses attributes to mark methods that should be used as event handlers.

member.param: The priority at which to register.
The event handler that should be registered for this event.

You can use normal syntax to register for events at Normal priority, so no special registration is needed; this is accessed through normal event handling syntax (the += syntax in C#, or the in Visual Basic.

Events in the JinxBot API are never guaranteed to be executed on the UI thread. Events that affect the user interface should be marshaled back to the UI thread by the event handling code. Generally, high-priority event handlers are raised on the thread that is parsing data from Battle.net, and lower-priority event handler are executed from the thread pool.

JinxBot guarantees that all event handlers will be fired regardless of exceptions raised in previous event handlers. However, if a plugin repeatedly raises an exception, it may be forcefully unregistered from events.

To be well-behaved within JinxBot, plugins should always unregister themselves when they are being unloaded or when they otherwise need to do so. Plugins may opt-in to a Reflection-based event handling registration system which uses attributes to mark methods that should be used as event handlers.

member.param: The priority at which to register.
The event handler that should be registered for this event.

Events in the JinxBot API are never guaranteed to be executed on the UI thread. Events that affect the user interface should be marshaled back to the UI thread by the event handling code. Generally, high-priority event handlers are raised on the thread that is parsing data from Battle.net, and lower-priority event handler are executed from the thread pool.

JinxBot guarantees that all event handlers will be fired regardless of exceptions raised in previous event handlers. However, if a plugin repeatedly raises an exception, it may be forcefully unregistered from events.

To be well-behaved within JinxBot, plugins should always unregister themselves when they are being unloaded or when they otherwise need to do so. Plugins may opt-in to a Reflection-based event handling registration system which uses attributes to mark methods that should be used as event handlers.

member.param: The priority at which to register.
The event handler that should be registered for this event.

To be well-behaved within JinxBot, plugins should always unregister themselves when they are being unloaded or when they otherwise need to do so. Plugins may opt-in to a Reflection-based event handling registration system which uses attributes to mark methods that should be used as event handlers.

member.param: The priority at which to register.
The event handler that should be registered for this event.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.BeginClanCandidatesSearch(System.String)
member.summary: Begins searching for clan candidates in the channel and friends list, and checks the availability of the specified clan tag.
member.param: The clan tag to check for availability.
member.returns: The request ID assigned to the request.

remarks.para: This method will return immediately, but will cause the ClanCandidatesSearchCompleted event to be fired. That event does not specifically indicate that the proper number of candidates were found, simply that Battle.net responded. The event arguments sent as part of the event indicate the success or failure of the request.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.RespondToClanInvitation(BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanInvitationEventArgs,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Responds to a clan invitation received via the ClanInvitationReceived event.
member.param: The arguments that accompanied the invitation.
to accept the invitation and join the clan; otherwise .

remarks.para: Following the acceptance of an invitation, the client should receive ClanMembershipReceived and automatically respond by requesting clan membership information.

members.member:
Attempts to change the specified clan member's rank.
This method does not attempt to verify that the current user is allowed to change the specified user's rank, or even if the specified user exists or is in the current user's clan. The results of this method call are returned via the ClanRankChangeResponseReceived event.
The name of the user to change. The user's new rank. Thrown if is not a valid value of the ClanRank enumeration. Thrown if is or zero-length.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.#ctor(BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings)

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.Send(BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataBuffer)
member.summary: Sends a data buffer to the server.
member.param: The buffer to send.

remarks.para: Use of this method is preferred when sending binary messages because, after sending the buffer, it frees the buffer from the outgoing buffer pool. If you are only sending a text command, you should use Send(string); it not only automatically creates the packet, but uses the speed delay provider, if any, assigned to the CommandQueueProvider property.

member.exception: Thrown if the client is not connected.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.CreateAccount
member.summary: Creates a new account, attempting to use the login information provided in the settings.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.ContinueLogin
member.summary: Allows the client to continue logging in if the login has stopped due to a non-existent username or password.

remarks.para: If a LoginFailed event occurs, the client is not automatically disconnected. The UI can then present an interface by which the user may modify the client's Settings instance with proper login information. Once this has been done, the user may then call this method to attempt to log in again.
This method does not need to be called after the AccountCreated event.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.RegisterCustomPacketHandler(BNSharp.BncsPacketId,BNSharp.Plugins.ParseCallback,BNSharp.Plugins.ParseCallback@)
member.summary: Registers a custom handler for a specific packet ID. This method is not CLS-compliant.
member.param: The packet to register to handle.
A callback that will handle the data.
A previous parser, or if no parser was set to handle such a packet.
member.returns: A sink to fire off BattleNetClient events.
member.exception: Thrown if is .
Thrown if refers to the Warden value, or if the value is greater than 255 or less than 0.

remarks.para: This method can be used to replace the default BN# packet handlers or to augment them with new handlers. For example, BN# does not and will not likely ever support Diablo II Realms and Realm Character login. However, third-party developers can augment BN# to handle those packets and support events on their own.

The IBattleNetEvents sink is the same for subsequent calls to this method per-instance of BattleNetClient, so you don't need to do anything special with the return value each time you call this method.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.UnregisterCustomPacketHandler(BNSharp.BncsPacketId,BNSharp.Plugins.ParseCallback)
member.summary: Unregisters a custom handler for a specific packet ID, restoring the previous handler. This method is not CLS-compliant.
member.param: The packet ID for which to unregister.
The previous parser. If none was provided during registration, this value may be .
member.exception: Thrown if refers to the Warden value, or if the value is greater than 255 or less than 0.

member.name: E:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.ServerErrorReceived
member.summary: Informs listeners that an error message was received from the server.

remarks.para: Registering for this event with this member will register with Normal priority. To register for High or Low priority, use the RegisterServerErrorReceivedNotification and UnregisterServerErrorReceivedNotification methods.

Events in the JinxBot API are never guaranteed to be executed on the UI thread. Events that affect the user interface should be marshaled back to the UI thread by the event handling code. Generally, high-priority event handlers are raised on the thread that is parsing data from Battle.net, and lower-priority event handler are executed from the thread pool.

JinxBot guarantees that all event handlers will be fired regardless of exceptions raised in previous event handlers. However, if a plugin repeatedly raises an exception, it may be forcefully unregistered from events.

member.name: E:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.MessageSent
member.summary: Informs listeners that the client has sent a message to Battle.net.

remarks.para: The event handlers should check the EventType property of the event arguments to determine whether this event was an emote or a standard talk command and present the text appropriately.

Registering for this event with this member will register with Normal priority. To register for High or Low priority, use the RegisterMessageSentNotification and UnregisterMessageSentNotification methods.

member.name: E:BNSharp.BattleNet.BattleNetClient.CommandSent
member.summary: Informs listeners that a command was sent to the server.

remarks.para: This event is fired whenever the user sends a slash command to the server, except for /me or /emote commands. The /me and /emote commands are informed through the MessageSent event.

Registering for this event with this member will register with Normal priority. To register for High or Low priority, use the RegisterCommandSentNotification and UnregisterCommandSentNotification methods.

Events in the JinxBot API are never guaranteed to be executed on the UI thread. Events that affect the user interface should be marshaled back to the UI thread by the event handling code. Generally, high-priority event handlers are raised on the thread that is parsing data from Battle.net, and lower-priority event handler are executed from the thread pool.

JinxBot guarantees that all event handlers will be fired regardless of exceptions raised in previous event handlers. However, if a plugin repeatedly raises an exception, it may be forcefully unregistered from events.

member.name: T:BNSharp.BattleNet.Product
member.summary: Represents a Battle.net chat product. This class cannot be instantiated.

remarks.para: This class is primarily designed to provide information about products supported on Battle.net. In order to obtain an instance of it, access one of the static fields. Equality can also be tested by comparing a user's product to an instance retrieved from the fields exposed by this class.

member.summary: Indicates that the request has failed.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.OldAuth
member.summary: Calculates hash values for data using the old login-system checks.
member.remarks: This method of logon would be used in down-level clients using the SID_CLIENTID, SID_CLIENTID2, or SID_AUTH_INFO messages specifying the login style 0 (Old login system).
member.threadsafety: This type is safe for multithreaded operations.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.OldAuth.HashData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Calculates the single "broken" SHA-1 hash of the specified data.
member.param: The data buffer to hash.
member.returns: A 20-byte buffer containing the hash value.

member.summary: Calculates the single "broken" SHA-1 hash of the specified password using ASCII encoding.
member.param: The password to hash.
member.returns: A 20-byte buffer containing the hash value.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.OldAuth.DoubleHashData(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the double-pass "broken" SHA-1 hash of the specified data.
member.param: The data buffer to hash.
The client token, a randomly-generated value specified by the client.
The server token, a randomly-generated value specified by the server.
member.returns: A 20-byte buffer containing the hash value.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.OldAuth.DoubleHashPassword(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the double-pass "broken" SHA-1 hash of the specified password using ASCII encoding.
member.param: The password to hash.
The client token, a randomly-generated value specified by the client.
The server token, a randomly-generated value specified by the server.
member.returns: A 20-byte buffer containing the hash value.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.OldAuth.DoubleHashPassword(System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Calculates the double-pass "broken" SHA-1 hash of the specified password using ASCII encoding. This method is not CLS-compliant.
member.param: The password to hash.
The client token, a randomly-generated value specified by the client.
The server token, a randomly-generated value specified by the server.
member.returns: A 20-byte buffer containing the hash value.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.OldAuth.DoubleHashData(System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Calculates the double-pass "broken" SHA-1 hash of the specified data. This method is not CLS-compliant.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Net.BnFtpVersion2Request
member.summary: Represents a Battle.net FTP (BnFTP) file transfer request for Version 2 products.

remarks.para: This class is only valid for Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos and Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne. For Starcraft Retail, Starcraft: Brood War, Diablo II Retail, Diablo II: Lord of Destruction, and Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition clients, use the BnFtpVersion1Request class.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Net.BnFtpRequestBase
member.summary: Represents a generic Battle.net FTP (BnFTP) request.

remarks.para: The specific Battle.net FTP protocol is implemented by the BnFtpVersion1Request and BnFtpVersion2Request classes, which have their uses based on which client is being emulated. For Warcraft 3 and The Frozen Throne, BnFtpVersion2Request should be used; otherwise, BnFtpVersion1Request should be used.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Net.BnFtpRequestBase.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Creates a new generic Battle.net FTP request.
member.param: The name of the file to be downloaded.
The four-character product string specifying the client being emulated.
The timestamp of the file's last write in UTC. You may specify null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the time is unavailable.

remarks.para:
Valid emulation clients include:
STAR for Starcraft Retail
SEXP for Starcraft: Brood War
W2BN for Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition
D2DV for Diablo II Retail
D2XP for Diablo II: Lord of Destruction
WAR3 for Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos
W3XP for Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne

remarks.para: Note to Inheritors: The suggested way to hook the FilePartDownloaded event is to override this method. However, to ensure that the event is called and all listeners receive it, be certain to call the base implementation as well.

member.param: The download status for this file.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Net.BnFtpRequestBase.ExecuteRequest
member.summary: Executes the BnFTP request, downloading the file to where LocalFileName specifies, and closes the connection.

remarks.para: By default, LocalFileName is the same name as the remote file, which will cause the file to be saved in the local application path. The desired location of the file must be set before ExecuteRequest is called.

member.exception: Thrown if the local file cannot be written.
Thrown if the remote host closes the connection prematurely.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.BncsReader
member.summary: Completes a DataBuffer implementation with the additional data used by the BNCS protocol.

remarks.para: When using this class with a Stream, the BncsReader only takes the next packet's data off of the stream. An ideal example of this would be when using a NetworkSteam to connect to Battle.net. Incidentally, this constructor and method will block execution until new data has arrived. Therefore, if your main receiving loop is going to use these methods, it should be on a background worker loop.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.DataReader
member.summary: Operates as a buffered data reader for network and file input.

remarks.para: This class does not write data in any manner; for writing or sending data, use the DataBuffer or derived classes.
This class always uses little-endian byte ordering.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevision
member.summary: Encompasses any revision check functionality for all Battle.net games. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: This class provides all CheckRevision-related support, including file checksumming and EXE version information.
member.threadsafety: This type is safe for multithreaded operations.

members.member: These are the hashcodes for the various .mpq files.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevision.ExtractMPQNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Extracts the MPQ number from the MPQ specified by the Battle.net server.

remarks.para: For older CheckRevision calls, the MPQ number is a required parameter of the CheckRevision function. Note that the MPQ number is simply the number represented in string format in the 8th position (index 7) of the string -- for example, in "IX86ver1.mpq", 1 is the version number.

member.param: The name of the MPQ file specified in the SID_AUTH_INFO message.
member.returns: The number from 0 to 7 specifying the number in the MPQ file.
member.exception: Thrown if the name of the MPQ version file is less than 8 characters long.
Thrown if the mpqName parameter is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Thrown if the mpqName parameter indicates a Lockdown DLL.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevision.DoCheckRevision(System.String,System.String[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the revision check for the specified files.
member.param: The value string for the check revision function specified by Battle.net's SID_AUTH_INFO message.
The list of files for the given game client. This parameter must be exactly three files long.
The number of the MPQ file. To extract this number, see the ExtractMPQNumber method.
member.returns: The checksum value.
member.exception: Thrown if the valueString or files parameters are null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Thrown if is not a 3-string array, or if is outside of the range of 0 to 7, inclusive.
Thrown if one of the specified game files is not found.
Thrown in the event of a general I/O error.

remarks.para: The file list for this is product-specific and order-specific:

item.term: Starcraft; Starcraft: Brood War
Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition
Diablo II; Diablo II: Lord of Destruction
Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos; Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne

member.summary: Performs the Lockdown revision check.
member.param: The value string parameter, not including the null terminator.
The three game files. This parameter must be exactly three files long.
The path to the lockdown file requested.
The path to the screen dump.
[return value] The EXE version.
[return value] The EXE hash.
member.returns: The "EXE Information" data. This value should be null-terminated when being inserted into the authorization packet.

remarks.para: The file list for this is product-specific and order-specific:

item.term: Starcraft; Starcraft: Brood War
Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition

Returns the file's timestamp and other information.
member.returns: The file's version.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevision.GetVersionByte(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the current "version byte" for the specified product.

remarks.para: Only the following product IDs can be used with the web service: STAR, SEXP, W2BN, D2DV, D2XP, WAR3, and W3XP. Other product IDs will result an a NotSupportedException being thrown.

para.span: This method is new and currently in testing. W2BN, D2DV, and D2XP are currently unsupported.

member.param: The four-character product ID for the product in question.
member.exception: Thrown in all cases.
member.returns: The version byte of the product.

member.name: P:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevision.AlwaysUseSlowCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use the slow revision check.

remarks.para: By default, the revision check operation for non-Lockdown clients uses dynamic compilation based on the standard format of the revision check formula (A=x B=y C=z 4 A=A?S B=B?C C=C?A A=A?B). If there is a compatibility problem, clients can disable the use of dynamic compilation by setting this property to .

In the current version of MBNCSUtil and BN#, setting this property to has the effect of causing the revision check process to use the LoadFilesOnDemand optimization strategy, regardless of the value of that property, to ensure 100% compatibility with the older version of the revision check formulas. Future versions will vary according to that property.

member.name: P:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevision.OptimizationStrategy
member.summary: Gets or sets the optimization strategy used by the revision check file loader.

remarks.para: For more information about the differences between the optimization strategies, see CheckRevisionOptimizationStrategy.
By default, this is set to CheckRevisionOptimizationStrategy.PreloadAllFilesAndClearAfterUse.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevisionOptimizationStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the optimization strategy that CheckRevision should use when loading files from disk.

member.name: F:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevisionOptimizationStrategy.PreloadAllFilesAndClearAfterUse
member.summary: Reads all the files and inserts the appropriate padding before executing the revision check, allowing the operation to execute in a single pass without (generally) needing to hit the disk. This is the default optimization strategy, and will use about 11mb of memory transitionally during the operation of the check, but will free it following the check.

member.name: F:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevisionOptimizationStrategy.PreloadAndPersistFiles
member.summary: Reads all of the files and inserts the appropriate padding before executing the revision check, based on a combination of the names of the files that are being used. This allows the operation to execute in a single pass without needing to hit the disk. When the revision check is completed, the file data are retained so that future calls don't need to recombine the file data. For clients that use classic revision check, this means that files will take about 11mb each. For clients that use lockdown, because the lockdown file is part of the hashed file data, this may be up to about 200mb. This strategy is probably ideal for applications similar to BNLS that need to focus on serving revision check requests, and not for general client use.

member.name: F:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.CheckRevisionOptimizationStrategy.LoadFilesOnDemand
member.summary: Reads files one kilobyte at a time, as the revision check needs the file data to be read in. This is probably the slowest optimization strategy, but it probably will hit the disk more than once during the operation. It also uses the least amount of memory.

member.name: T:BNSharp.BattleNetClientResources
member.summary: Provides global resources preallocated for performance.

The server key, sent from the server in SID_AUTH_ACCOUNTLOGON.

member.name: T:BNSharp.Priority
member.summary: Specifies priorities for data handling.

remarks.para: When using BNSharp for a simple client, use of the Priority enumeration is optional. However, if you want to develop something such as an extremely secure channel moderation client, it is highly recommended that you utilize both the prioritized packet parsing engine and the prioritized event handler system.

member.name: F:BNSharp.Priority.High
member.summary: Specifies the highest priority. This enumeration value is 5.

member.name: F:BNSharp.Priority.Normal
member.summary: Specifies the normal priority. This enumeration value is 3.

member.name: F:BNSharp.Priority.Low
member.summary: Specifies the lowest priority. This enumeration value is 1.

member.name: T:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool
member.summary: Implements a pool of byte arrays to improve allocation performance when parsing data.
member.threadsafety: This type is safe for multithreaded operations.

member.name: M:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new buffer pool with the specified name, buffer sizes, and buffer count.
member.param: The name of the pool.
The size of the preallocated buffers.
The number of preallocated buffers that should be available.
member.exception: Thrown if or are zero or negative.

member.name: M:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.Contains(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Determines whether the specified buffer is already free.
member.param: The buffer to check.
member.returns: if the buffer is freed; otherwise .

member.name: M:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.GetBuffer
member.summary: Gets a buffer from the available pool if one is available, or else allocates a new one.

remarks.para: Buffers retrieved with this method should be returned to the pool by using the FreeBuffer method.

member.returns: A byte[] from the pool.

member.name: M:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.FreeBuffer(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns the specified buffer to the pool.
member.returns: if the buffer belonged to this pool and was freed; otherwise .

remarks.para: If the ClearOnFree property is , then the buffer will be zeroed before being restored to the pool.

member.param: The buffer to return to the pool.
member.exception: Thrown if is .

member.name: M:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.IncreaseBufferCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Increases the number of buffers available in the pool by a given size.
member.param: The number of buffers to preallocate.
member.exception: Thrown if the system is unable to preallocate the requested number of buffers.
Thrown if is less than or equal to 0.

remarks.para: This method does not cause the NewBufferAllocated event to be raised.

member.name: M:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.DecreaseBufferCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes up to the specified number of buffers from the pool.
member.param: The number of buffers to attempt to remove.
member.returns: The number of buffers actually removed.

remarks.para: The number of buffers removed may actually be lower than the number requested if the specified number of buffers are not free. For example, if the number of buffers free is 15, and the callee requests the removal of 20 buffers, only 15 will be freed, and so the returned value will be 15.

member.exception: Thrown if is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.OnNewBufferAllocated(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Fires the NewBufferAllocated event.
member.param: The event arguments.

member.summary: Raises the BufferRequested event.
member.param: The event arguments.

member.summary: Raises the BufferReturned event.
member.param: The event arguments.

member.summary: Gets the name of this pool.

remarks.para: If no name is set, this property may return .

member.name: P:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.BufferLength
member.summary: Gets the size of the buffers allocated from this pool.

member.name: P:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.MaxBufferCount
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of buffers available at any given time from this pool.

member.name: P:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.BuffersAvailable
member.summary: Gets the current number of buffers available for use.

member.name: P:BNSharp.Net.BufferPool.ClearOnFree
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to zero the contents of a buffer when it is freed.

remarks.para: The default value of this is ; however, it may be set to to achieve a minor performance increase.

member.summary: Informs listeners when a new buffer beyond the initial length has been allocated.

member.summary: Informs listeners that a buffer has been allocated.

member.name: T:BNSharp.Plugins.ICommandQueue
member.summary: Implements an outgoing command queue, which allows the client to delay, filter, or reorder messages that are waiting to be sent to prevent flooding. The default implementation does not delay or reorder messages.

member.name: M:BNSharp.Plugins.ICommandQueue.EnqueueMessage(System.String,BNSharp.Priority)
member.summary: Queues a message to be sent.
member.param: The message to send.
The priority of the message.

remarks.para: This method should not need to be called from user code; it is called automatically when BattleNetClient.Send is called.
When implementing this interface, the parameter may be ignored depending on implementation.

In addition to enqueuing a message, it is possible to implement this method to filter specific types of messages from being sent. For instance, a simple filter may prevent a password from being sent over the wire.

member.name: M:BNSharp.Plugins.ICommandQueue.Clear
member.summary: Clears any messages enqueued for sending.

remarks.para: This method is called when the BattleNetClient is disconnected.

member.name: E:BNSharp.Plugins.ICommandQueue.MessageReady
member.summary: Informs listeners that a message is ready to be sent over the wire.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Data.MpqFileStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads data from the underlying stream into the specified buffer.
member.param: The buffer that will receive the data.
The starting location in the buffer to get the data.
The amount of data to be read.

remarks.para: Rather than throwing an exception, if the buffer is too small to return the requested amount of data, only as much data as the buffer can hold is returned.

member.returns: The number of bytes read.

member.returns: The new position in the file.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Data.BniFileParser
member.summary: Provides a parser for .bni files from Starcraft and Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition.

remarks.para: It is incorrect to attempt to use this class to read a Warcraft III .BNI file. Those files are .MPQ files, and should be read using the MpqArchive class.

member.summary: Creates a new BNI file parser to parse the specified file.
member.param: The path to the file to parse.
member.exception: Thrown if the file specified in does not exist.
Thrown if the file contains data types that are unsupported by this implementation.

member.summary: Creates a new BNI file parser from the specified stream.
member.param: The stream to load.
member.exception: Thrown if is .
Thrown if the file contains data types that are unsupported by this implementation.

member.summary: Disposes the object, freeing any managed and unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings
member.summary: When implemented, provides the necessary settings to establish a Battle.net client connection.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.Client
member.summary: Gets or sets the client product code.

remarks.para: There are seven clients that may be currently emulated using BN#:

item.term: Starcraft (Retail)
Starcraft: Brood War
Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition
Diablo II (Retail)
Diablo II: The Lord of Destruction
Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos
Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.VersionByte
member.summary: Gets or sets the version byte.

remarks.para: The version byte is a value that cannot be reliably retrieved from game files. It can be found on most web sites, or is generally updated on the JinxBot Wiki.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.CdKey1
member.summary: Gets or sets the Product CD key.

remarks.para: This property is required for all products.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.CdKey2
member.summary: Gets or sets the Expansion Product CD key, if applicable.

remarks.para: This property is only required when emulating Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne or Diablo II: Lord of Destruction. However, when emulating the down-level clients, it will still be used if it is supported (for example, when logging onto Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos even though you have Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne installed).

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.GameExe
member.summary: Gets or sets the full or relative path to the executable file used for revision checking.

remarks.para: This file varies by client.

item.term: Starcraft; Starcraft: Brood War
Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition
Diablo II; Diablo II: Lord of Destruction
Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos; Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.GameFile2
member.summary: Gets or sets the full or relative path to the second file used for revision checking.

remarks.para: This file varies by client.

item.term: Starcraft; Starcraft: Brood War; Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition; Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos; Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne
Diablo II; Diablo II: Lord of Destruction

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.GameFile3
member.summary: Gets or sets the full or relative path to the third file used for revision checking.

remarks.para: This file varies by client.

item.term: Starcraft; Starcraft: Brood War; Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition
Diablo II; Diablo II: Lord of Destruction
Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos; Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.Username
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the account that should be used to connect.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.ImageFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the full or relative path to the file used for Lockdown revision checking.

remarks.para: This property is not required for products other than Starcraft and Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password of the account used to connect.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.Server
member.summary: Gets or sets the name or IP address of the server used to connect.

alert.para: The Port property has been deprecated in BN# Beta 3 in favor of the Gateway property. Its value is now ignored.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the port that should be used to connect.

alert.para: The Port property has been deprecated in BN# Beta 3 in favor of the Gateway property. Its value is now ignored.

remarks.para: The default port for Battle.net is 6112.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.Gateway
member.summary: Gets or sets the Gateway that should be used to connect to the server.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.CdKeyOwner
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the CD Key Owner.

remarks.para: This name is the one that appears if you attempt to log in with the CD key while it is already logged in.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.PingMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of ping that should be used for the connection.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.HomeChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets the channel the client should join when first logging in.

remarks.para: If this property returns or an empty string, then the standard channel join will be performed (for example, a client connecting with Starcraft: Brood War emulation might join the channel Brood War USA-2).

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.IsPvPGN
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this instance is connecting to a PvPGN server.

member.name: P:BNSharp.IBattleNetSettings.Trigger
member.summary: Gets or sets a trigger for issueing commands.

member.name: T:BNSharp.ChannelFlags
member.summary: Specifies the flags that can be applied to channel-related chat events.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChannelFlags.None
member.summary: Specifies that the channel is a normal private channel.

member.summary: Specifies that the channel is public.

member.summary: Specifies that the channel is restricted.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChannelFlags.SilentChannel
member.summary: Specifies that the channel is silent.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChannelFlags.SystemChannel
member.summary: Specifies that the channel is provided by the system.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChannelFlags.ProductSpecificChannel
member.summary: Specifies that the channel is specific to a product.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChannelFlags.GloballyAccessibleChannel
member.summary: Specifies that the channel is globally-accessible.

member.name: T:BNSharp.BattleNet.ProfileRecordKeyType

member.name: F:BNSharp.BattleNet.ProfileRecordKeyType.Normal

member.name: F:BNSharp.BattleNet.ProfileRecordKeyType.Ladder
member.summary: Specifies Ladder. This is valid on Starcraft, Diablo, and Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition.

member.name: F:BNSharp.BattleNet.ProfileRecordKeyType.IronManLadder
member.summary: Specifies an Iron Man Ladder. This is only valid on Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition.

member.name: T:BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanMember
member.summary: Represents a Battle.net Clan member.

remarks.para: This class cannot be directly instantiated. Rather, it is provided when you log on via the TODO event.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanMember.#ctor(System.String,BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanRank)
member.summary: Creates a new ClanMember for a user who is currently offline.
member.param: The clan member's user name.
The clan member's rank.

member.name: M:BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanMember.#ctor(System.String,BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanRank,BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanMemberStatus,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ClanMember for a user who is online or offline.
member.param: The clan member's user name.
The clan member's rank.
The clan member's current status.
The name of the member's current location (such as a channel or game name).

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanMember.Username
member.summary: Gets the user's name.

remarks.para: When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name Username.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanMember.Rank
member.summary: Gets, and in derived classes sets, the user's current rank within the clan.

remarks.para: When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name Rank.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanMember.CurrentStatus
member.summary: Gets, and in derived classes sets, the current location and status of the clan member.

remarks.para: When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name OnlineStatus.

member.name: P:BNSharp.BattleNet.Clans.ClanMember.Location
member.summary: Gets, and in derived classes sets, the user's current Battle.net location, if the user is online.

remarks.para: This property will return if the user is not online.
When exposed under a WCF data contract, this property's backing store is given the name Location.

member.name: T:BNSharp.Plugins.QueuedMessageReadyCallback
member.summary: Informs the BattleNetClient that a queued message is ready to be sent to the server.
member.param: The message to be sent to the server.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Net.BnFtpVersion1Request
member.summary: Represents a Battle.net FTP (BnFTP) file transfer request for Version 1 products.

remarks.para: This class is only valid for Starcraft Retail, Starcraft: Brood War, Diablo II Retail, Diablo II: Lord of Destruction, and Warcraft II: Battle.net Edition clients. For Warcraft III: The Reign of Chaos and Warcraft III: The Frozen Throne, use the BnFtpVersion2Request class.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Net.BnFtpVersion1Request.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Creates a standard Version 1 Battle.net FTP request.
member.param: The four-character identifier for the product being emulated by this request.
The full or relative path to the file as it is to be stored on the local machine. The name portion of the file must be the filename being requested from the service.
The last-write time of the file. If the file is not available, this parameter can be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Net.BnFtpVersion1Request.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Version 1 Battle.net FTP request specifically for banner ad downloads.
member.param: The four-character identifier for the product being emulated by this request.
The full or relative path to the file as it is to be stored on the local machine. The name portion of the file must be the filename being requested from the service.
The last-write time of the file. If the file is not available, this parameter can be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The banner ID provided by Battle.net's ad notice message.
The banner filename extension provided by Battle.net's ad notice message.

remarks.para: Although it is not specifically required to download banner ads, it is recommended for forward-compatibility with the Battle.net protocol that this constructor is used.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Net.BnFtpVersion1Request.ExecuteRequest
member.summary: Executes the BnFTP request, downloading the file to where LocalFileName specifies, and closes the connection.

remarks.para: By default, LocalFileName is the same name as the remote file, which will cause the file to be saved in the local application path. The desired location of the file must be set before ExecuteRequest is called.

member.exception: Thrown if the local file cannot be written.
Thrown if the remote host closes the connection prematurely.

member.name: T:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Data.MpqArchive

member.summary: Determines whether the archive contains the specified file.

member.returns: True if the file is contained within the MPQ; otherwise false.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Data.MpqArchive.SaveToPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the specified file to the provided path.
member.param: The fully-qualified name of the file in the MPQ.
The path to which to save the file.

remarks.para: The file is saved as an immediate child of the path specified in .

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Data.MpqArchive.SaveToPath(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the specified file to the specified path, optionally expanding the paths used in the MPQ.
member.param: The fully-qualified name of the file in the MPQ.
The root path to which to save the file.
Whether to create child directories based on the path to the file in the MPQ.

member.summary: Called when the .NET Framework is removing this object from memory.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Data.MpqArchive.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes this archive.

remarks.para: If you call Dispose on an archive you do not need to call MpqServices.CloseArchive to close it.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Data.MpqArchive.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cleans up unmanaged resources used by this archive.
member.param: true if the object is being disposed; false if it is being finalized.

member.name: M:BNSharp.MBNCSUtil.Data.MpqArchive.GetListFile
member.summary: Gets the full text of the MPQ list file.

remarks.para: In later versions of Blizzard's games, the developers included a file called "(listfile)" in most MPQ archives identifying the names of the files contained in the MPQ (since they are hashed and therefore unavailable otherwise).

member.returns: A string containing the full text of the list file.
member.exception: Thrown if the list file is not located.

member.name: T:BNSharp.LoginFailureReason
member.summary: Specifies the known reasons for a login failure to have occurred.

member.name: F:BNSharp.LoginFailureReason.Unknown
member.summary: Specifies that an unknown reason caused the login failure.

member.name: F:BNSharp.LoginFailureReason.AccountDoesNotExist
member.summary: Specifies that the selected account does not exist. This status is only available when the ProvidesExtendedInformation property of the login failure arguments is .

member.name: F:BNSharp.LoginFailureReason.InvalidAccountOrPassword
member.summary: Specifies that either the account was not found, or that the password was invalid. For extended information check the ProvidesExtendedInformation property of the login failure arguments.

member.name: F:BNSharp.LoginFailureReason.AccountClosed
member.summary: Specifies that the account has been closed. This status is only available when the ProvidesExtendedInformation property of the login failure arguments is .

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.None
member.summary: Specifies an invalid chat event type.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.UserInChannel
member.summary: Indicates that another user was already in the current channel when it was joined by the client.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.UserJoinedChannel
member.summary: Indicates that another user has joined the current channel.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.UserLeftChannel
member.summary: Indicates that another user has left the current channel.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.WhisperReceived
member.summary: Indicates that another user has whispered the client.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.Talk
member.summary: Indicates that a user in the current channel spoke.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.Broadcast
member.summary: Indicates that a server operator has broadcast a message.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.NewChannelJoined
member.summary: Indicates that the client joined a new channel.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.UserFlagsChanged
member.summary: Indicates that a user's channel properties have been updated.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.WhisperSent
member.summary: Indicates that a whisper was sent.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.ChannelFull
member.summary: Indicates that a channel join failed because the channel is full.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.ChannelDNE
member.summary: Indicates that a channel view failed because the channel does not exist.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.ChannelRestricted
member.summary: Indicates that a channel join failed because the channel is restricted.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.Information
member.summary: Indicates that the server is relaying information, perhaps from a command.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.Error
member.summary: Indicates that there was a command error.

member.name: F:BNSharp.ChatEventType.Emote
